subject: Real Estate
title: Australia's Terra Nullius Fiction
description: Learn Australia's Terra Nullius Fiction in one minute.

hook.text: When Britain claimed Australia in 1788, it declared the continent 'terra nullius' â€” land belonging to no one.

buildup.text: Aboriginal Australians had lived there for over 65,000 years, but British law required European-style deeds.

discovery.text: Without fences or written titles, indigenous land use was invisible to colonial legal systems.

twist.text: In 1992, the Mabo decision finally overturned terra nullius, recognizing native title for the first time.

climax.text: It took 204 years for the legal system to acknowledge what had always been true.

punchline.text: Calling occupied land 'empty' was a legal fiction.

quiz.question: What did 'terra nullius' mean in Australian colonial law?
